p: It was suggested that pectic polysaccharides can be an effective organic matrix for the delivery of the macroelements and and microelements that are necessary for normal metabolism. Novel water-soluble pectin complexes with Fe 2+, Zn 2+, Mg 2+, Ca 2+, Co 2+, Cu 2+, and Mn 2+ based on pectic polysaccharides were synthesized, and the animal assays were conducted on rats. The anti-anemic effects of new pectin complexes with (1) Na and Fe, and (2) Na, Ca, and Fe were studied in white rats with post-hemorrhagic anemia. As a result of the action of the complexes, an improvement in the state of the animals and the prevention of erythropoiesis disorders were observed. The anti-anemic effect of the complexes was manifested in doses equivalent to 25% or 50% of the daily iron norm, which was recommended in the treatment of iron deficiency anemia with preparations based on ferrous sulfate [ 142].
